template.template: Template OS Windows Server Failover Cluster
template.name: Template OS Windows Server Failover Cluster
template.description:
Windows Server Failover Cluster Template Tested on Windows Server 2008 R2 SP1, Zabbix v 2.4.
https://github.com/zbx-sadman/WSFC
Requirement: wsfc.ps1 v.0.9

item_prototype.name: [{#CLUSTER}] Network {#NAME} role
item_prototype.description:
Role of the network in the cluster.
0 - ClusterNetworkRoleNone The network is not used by the cluster.
1 - ClusterNetworkRoleInternalUse The network is used to carry internal cluster communication.
2 - ClusterNetworkRoleClientAccess Not supported.
3 - ClusterNetworkRoleInternalAndClient The network is used to connect client systems and to carry internal cluster communication.

item_prototype.name: [{#CLUSTER}] Node {#NAME} assigned (Used) Memory
item_prototype.description: The total of current memory usage of the virtual systems on clusternode.

item_prototype.name: [{#CLUSTER}] Node {#NAME} assigned vCPUs
item_prototype.description: The total number of virtual processors allocated to the virtual systems on clusternode.

item_prototype.name: [{#CLUSTER}] Node {#NAME} processor load
item_prototype.description: The total current processor usage of the virtual systems on clusternode.

trigger_prototype.name: [{#CLUSTER}] CSV {#NAME} Free disk space is less than 1GB
[{#CLUSTER}] CSV {#NAME} Free disk space is less than 1GB
[{#CLUSTER}] CSV {#NAME} Free disk space is less than 20%

item_prototype.name: [{#NAME}] Assigned (Used) Memory
item_prototype.description: The total of current memory usage of the virtual systems on cluster.

item_prototype.name: [{#NAME}] Assigned vCPUs
item_prototype.description: The total number of virtual processors allocated to the virtual systems on cluster.

item_prototype.name: [{#NAME}] BackupInProgress
item_prototype.description: Indicates whether or not a Volume Shadow Copy Service Task is currently in progress for a specific volume on the cluster

item_prototype.name: [{#NAME}] FixQuorum
item_prototype.description: Specifies if the cluster is in a fix quorum state

item.host: Template OS Windows Server Failover Cluster
Template OS Windows Server Failover Cluster
Template OS Windows Server Failover Cluster
Template OS Windows Server Failover Cluster

item_prototype.name: [{#CLUSTER}] GS {#NAME} persistentState
item_prototype.description: Specifies whether the resource should be brought online or left offline when the Cluster service is started.

item_prototype.name: [{#CLUSTER}] GS {#NAME} restartAction
item_prototype.description:
0 - ClusterResourceDontRestart Do not restart the resource after a failure.
1 - ClusterResourceRestartNoNotify Restart the resource after a failure. If the resource exceeds its restart threshold within its restart period, do not attempt to failover the group to another node in the cluster.
2 - ClusterResourceRestartNotify Restart the resource after a failure. If the resource exceeds its restart threshold within its restart period, attempt to fail over the group to another node in the cluster. This is the default setting.

item_prototype.name: [{#CLUSTER}] VM {#NAME} checkHeartbeat
item_prototype.description:
Indicates whether the heartbeat of the virtual machine (VM) should be used to determine the health of the VM.
0 - Don't Check Heartbeat (Default) The heartbeat is not checked.
1 - Check Heartbeat The heartbeat is checked; if the heartbeat fails, a resource failure is signaled.

item_prototype.name: [{#CLUSTER}] VM {#NAME} heartbeat
item_prototype.description:
The current heartbeat status for the virtual system.
2 - OK 6 - Error 12 - No Contact 13 - Lost Communication

item_prototype.name: [{#CLUSTER}] VM {#NAME} migrationFailureReason
item_prototype.description:
Provides the HRESULT that details the reason for a failed live migration.
0 - S_OK (Default) The migration completed successfully.
0x800700AA - E_BUSY The migration failed because another migration was in progress.
0x80004005 - E_FAIL The migration failed for some other reason.

item_prototype.name: [{#CLUSTER}] VM {#NAME} migrationProgress
item_prototype.description: The estimated percentage of the completion of the migration.

item_prototype.name: [{#CLUSTER}] VM {#NAME} migrationState
item_prototype.description:
0 - No (Default) No migration is in progress.
1 - Setup The migration of the VM was started and the setup of the migration is in progress.
2 - Data Transfer The VM data (including the contents of the VM memory) is being transferred to the target node.
3 - Move The move of the VM resource group is in progress.
4 - Canceled An earlier migration attempt was canceled.
5 - Failure An earlier migration attempt failed. The MigrationState property will retain this value until it is reset or another migration is started.

item_prototype.name: [{#CLUSTER}] VM {#NAME} offlineAction
item_prototype.description:
0 - Turn Off The VM is turned off.
1 - Save (Default) The VM is saved.
2 - Shutdown The guest operating system running in the VM is shut down. This requires that the guest operating system has the shutdown integration component installed.
3 - Shutdown (Forced) The Windows guest operating system running in the VM is shut down forcibly.

item_prototype.name: [{#CLUSTER}] VM {#NAME} persistentState
item_prototype.description: Specifies whether the resource should be brought online or left offline when the Cluster service is started.

item_prototype.name: [{#CLUSTER}] VM {#NAME} restartAction
item_prototype.description:
0 - ClusterResourceDontRestart Do not restart the resource after a failure.
1 - ClusterResourceRestartNoNotify Restart the resource after a failure. If the resource exceeds its restart threshold within its restart period, do not attempt to failover the group to another node in the cluster.
2 - ClusterResourceRestartNotify Restart the resource after a failure. If the resource exceeds its restart threshold within its restart period, attempt to fail over the group to another node in the cluster. This is the default setting.

item_prototype.name: [{#CLUSTER}] VM {#NAME} shutdownAction
item_prototype.description:
Defines the action performed on the virtual machine (VM) resource instance when actions outside the cluster (such as stopping the VM through the Hyper-V Manager or a shutdown of the operating system running in the VM) cause the VM to stop running.
0 - Offline resource (Default) The VM resource instance is taken offline.
1 - Fail resource The resource instance is marked as failed. The cluster service will respond to the failure based on the restart policy that is configured for the resource instance.

item_prototype.name: [{#CLUSTER}] VM {#NAME} vmState
item_prototype.description:
0 - Unknown (Default) The state of the VM could not be determined.
2 - Enabled The VM is running.
3 - Disabled The VM is turned off.
32768 - Paused The VM is paused.
32769 - Suspended The VM is in a saved state.
32770 - Starting The VM is starting.
32773 - Saving The VM is saving its state.
32774 - Stopping The VM is turning off.
32776 - Pausing The VM is pausing.
32777 - Resuming The VM is resuming from a paused state.
